creator: tjsb@slb.com
text:
The patch for LoggingManager (to follow) adds the following new methods:

getLoggerForClass()
getLoggerForClass(String ignored) - deprecated

These obtain the logger category from the class name (see bug 20532), but with 
the leading "org.apache." removed for brevity.

The original getLoggerFor(String cat) method is unchanged.

The log_level property can now be specified without a category; if present, 
this is used to set the default log priority, otherwise INFO is used.

The log_file property ("jmeter.log" if omitted) is now used to set the default 
log target.

The log_file property can now be specified with a category suffix, in which 
case the file name is used to set the log target for that category.

The jmeter.properties file now does not need any log_level or log_file entries.

All public methods are now static (the ones that were changed were not called 
externally).

The format has been changed to always use 5 characters for the priority, so 
that messages line up better.

Note that the patch does not require any changes to other code; logging should 
work much the same as before.
